citation.article-title: Fulvimonas soli gen. nov., sp. nov., a gamma-proteobacterium isolated from soil after enrichment on acetylated starch plastic.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Fulvimonas soli sp. nov.
Fulvimonas soli (so'li. L. neut. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the organism)
Deep-yellow, mucoid, low convex, translucent colonies, 2-3 mm in diameter and with entire margins, are formed on TSBA plates after 5 days at 28 °C.
Cellular, biochemical and physiological features are as described for the genus.
In addition, no growth occurs on L-arabinose, D-mannitol, D-gluconate, caprate, citrate or phenylacetate.
Degrades aesculin but does not liquefy gelatin or reduce nitrate.
Produces alkaline and acid phosphatase and β-D-galactosidase but not arginine dihydrolase or urease.
Growth occurs at 28-37 °C but not at 4 °C.
Additional features are given in Table 2.
Strains were isolated from a soil sample, after enrichment on acetylated starch plastic.
The G+C contents of two strains are 71.5 and 71.9 mol%.
